docs.abstract: Doctors said the baby I carried, with Trisomy 18, Down syndrome and heart failure, was unlikely to survive. My federal insurance plan would not cover an abortion.
docs.snippet: Doctors said the baby I carried, with Trisomy 18, Down syndrome and heart failure, was unlikely to survive. My federal insurance plan would not cover an abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, but so is the number of clinics offering it, and more are seeking free publicity with a method that seems jarring.

headline.seo: Ethical Questions Raised by In Vitro Raffle
headline.main: Clinic Raffles Could Make You a Winner, and Maybe a Mother
headline.print_headline: Clinic Raffles Could Make You A Winner, and Maybe a Mother

docs.abstract: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, as is number of clinics offering it, and fertility clinics around country have begun offering promotions such as contests or raffles to garner free publicity; medical ethicists worry that contests exploit vulnerable people and trivialize human conception.
docs.snippet: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, but so is the number of clinics offering it, and more are seeking free publicity with a method that seems jarring.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you are disabled, you can either work and not qualify for financial assistance, or you’re sick, and barred from earning any substantial income.

headline.seo: The Trap of Supplemental Security Income

docs.abstract: News analysis; Supplemental Security Income program, which is designed to help those with disabilities, has received little attention during presidential election, despite fact that other social safety net programs have been at forefront of presidential contest; SSI is actually source of problem for many it serves, as it limits their income to just above poverty line, and is taken away once they achieve any level of security.
docs.snippet: If you are disabled, you can either work and not qualify for financial assistance, or you’re sick, and barred from earning any substantial income.

byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ and JULIET LINDERMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: With trickle-down aviation and other happy talk, Marco Rubio distills the avoidance of hard truths.
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column describes conversation between Florida Sen Marco Rubio, rising star in Republican party, and group of journalists, and laments that Rubio employs his considerable talent and charisma to avoid hard truths about country and choices it faces; contends presidential candidates are no better, and it says much about sorry state of politics.
docs.snippet: With trickle-down aviation and other happy talk, Marco Rubio distills the avoidance of hard truths.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have been obfuscating their plans for Medicare, Medicaid and what they will do to reform the health care system.

headline.seo: The Republican Ticket Twists the Facts About Health Care
headline.main: Twisting the Facts About Health Care
headline.print_headline: Twisting the Facts About Health Care

docs.abstract: Editorial contends it is difficult to evaluate difference between Pres Obama's health care plan and Mitt Romney's health care proposals because Romney has been so artful about obfuscating his plans for reforming system; highlights major gaps in Romney's policy proposals.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have been obfuscating their plans for Medicare, Medicaid and what they will do to reform the health care system.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: In a deeply divided swing state, former Gov. Tommy Thompson and Representative Tammy Baldwin have changed their minds on issues from health care to Iran.

headline.seo: In Wisconsin, Two Senate Candidates Shift Their Positions
headline.main: In Wisconsin, Senate Candidates Shift Their Positions
headline.print_headline: In a Volatile Swing State, Two Senate Candidates Shift From Prior Positions

docs.abstract: David Firestone Editorial Observer criticizes former Gov Tommy Thompson, Republican candidate for Wisconsin Senate, for rapidly backing away from his progressive views on health care in cynical bid to win votes; notes while Thompson once supported policies similar to those contained in Affordable Care Act, he is now aggressively attacking them.
docs.snippet: In a deeply divided swing state, former Gov. Tommy Thompson and Representative Tammy Baldwin have changed their minds on issues from health care to Iran.

docs.lead_paragraph: Every member of Congress has employees who do constituent service, helping people with thorny problems, often financial, that may involve a federal agency.

headline.seo: How Senators and Representatives Can Help Constituents
headline.main: When to Call Your Elected Representatives for Help
headline.print_headline: When to Call Your Elected Representatives for Help

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column notes that all senators and congressman have employees who conduct constituent services, helping people with thorny problems, often financial, that may involve a federal agency; provides advice on how best to take advantage of these services.
docs.snippet: Every member of Congress has employees who do constituent service, helping people with thorny problems, often financial, that may involve a federal agency.

headline.main: The Early Word: Limitless in Missouri

docs.abstract: Political news from today's Times, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.
docs.snippet: Political news from today's Times, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: A provision of the law requiring members of Congress to use the new insurance exchanges has inspired a barrage of political advertising that some call misleading.

headline.seo: Democrats Use Obscure Health Law Provision
headline.main: Democrats Use Health Law to Assail Republicans
headline.print_headline: Democrats Use Health Law to Assail Republicans

docs.abstract: Little-noticed provision of the health care reform law requires members of Congress to obtain their health benefits through insurance exchanges being established in every state, rather than under traditional federal programs; Democrats are now running a barrage of television ads that portray opposition from Congressional Republicans to the law as a bid to regain taxpayer-funded health care for themselves.
docs.snippet: A provision of the law requiring members of Congress to use the new insurance exchanges has inspired a barrage of political advertising that some call misleading.

docs.lead_paragraph: Christopher S. Murphy, a three-term Democratic congressman, tried to put Linda E. McMahon on the defensive for Republican positions on contraceptives and abortion.

headline.seo: McMahon and Murphy, in Connecticut Senate Debate, Clash on Women’s Issues
headline.main: Women’s Issues at Fore in Final Debate for Connecticut Senate Seat
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Senate Rivals Spar Over Women’s Issues and Jobs in Their Final Debate

docs.abstract: Republican Linda E McMahon and Democrat Christopher S Murphy clash on women's issues and jobs in their fourth and final debate in Connecticut's hotly contested Senate race.
docs.snippet: Christopher S. Murphy, a three-term Democratic congressman, tried to put Linda E. McMahon on the defensive for Republican positions on contraceptives and abortion.
